intro: Tuberaria discolor, commonly known as the white-flowered rock rose, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in spring, often in clusters at the ends of its stems. Tuberaria discolor thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas and mountainous regions. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
